intro: Alsodeia obtusa, commonly known as the broadleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, succulent stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats. Alsodeia obtusa is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in harsh environments.
